If you haven't done this yet, I would go to http://code.google.com/p/warc-t=
ools/ and learn about Warc Tools. If you want to install it, this message f=
rom their mailing list is helpful: http://groups.google.com/group/warc-tool=
s/browse_thread/thread/f4a15168fc50999e#
Warc Tools has an Arc2Warc applica=
tion where you can specify if you want the warc compressed or not with the =
cmode argument.

Lauren
________________________________________

Sent: Wednesday, July 29, 2009 4:33 AM

Subject: [archive-crawler] Re: Reading war=
c and warc.gz files

Thanks a lot for this clarification!

So, assuming I h=
ave an arc file that I created using the crawler, how
then do I convert it =
to a warc.gz file?

--- In archive-crawler@yahoogroups.com<mailto:archive-c=
rawler%40yahoogroups.com>, "Ko, Lauren" <lauren.ko@...>
wrote:
>
> I think =
the issue you are having is arising because compressed warcs
are actually c=
reated by concatenating compressed warc records. When you
download the warc=
 from archive.org and test it against your code, each
record is compressed =
to specification so it works. When you uncompress
it then manually recompre=
ss the entire file yourself, each record is no
longer individually compress=
ed so it is failing.
>
> Lauren Ko
> Digital Projects Unit
> University of =
North Texas Libraries
> ________________________________________
> From: ar=
chive-crawler@yahoogroups.com<mailto:archive-crawler%40yahoogroups.com>
[ar=

>

>
> I am usin=
g the following code to read both warc and warc.gz files.
>
> warcReader =
=3D WARCReaderFactory.get(new
File(warcPath));
>
> Iterator<ArchiveRecord> =
it =3D warcReader.iterator();
> int counter=3D0;
> while (it.hasNext()) {
>=

> ArchiveRecord record =3D it.next();
> counter++;
> }
> System.out.printl=
n("Num of records in file is: "+counter);
>
> I tested this with the file d=
ownloaded from
http://www.archive.org/details/ExampleArcAndWarcFiles and it=
 worked
fine, I the decompressed the file and again it worked OK, but if I
=
compress the decompressed file, it will not manage to read more then 1
reco=
rd.
> The issue I have with warc file that I created myself.
> I have arc f=
iles that I created using the crawler, and then converted
them to warc usin=
g the Arc2Warc().transform call.
> The code works fine for the regular warc=
 files, but if I compress them
to warc.gz, it will never pass the first rec=
ord.
>
> Any idea?
>
